Package org.purl.wf4ever.wfdesc

This ontology ("wfdesc") describes an abstract workflow description structure, which on the top level is defined as a wfdesc:Workflow.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Artifact
    wfdesc:Artifact is used to provide information about a class of artifacts.
    DataLink
    wfdesc:DataLink is used to represent data dependencies between wfdesc:Process descriptions.
    Description  
    Input
    wfdesc:Input represents an input parameter to a wfdesc:Process.
    InputOrOutput  
    Output
    wfdesc:Output represents an output parameter from a wfdesc:Process.
    Parameter
    This class represent a parameter of a wfdesc:Process.
    Process
    A wfdesc:Process is used to describe a class of actions that when enacted give rise to processes.
    Workflow
    A wfdesc:Workflow is a directed graph in which the nodes are wfdesc:Process instances and the edges (wfdesc:DataLink instances) represent data dependencies between the constituent wfdesc:Process descriptions.
    WorkflowInstance
    A wfdesc:WorkflowInstance is a specialisation of a wfdesc:Workflow description which defines all data/parameters/settings that are required to form a wfprov:WorkflowRun.

Package org.purl.wf4ever.wfdesc Description

This ontology ("wfdesc") describes an abstract workflow description structure, which on the top level is defined as a wfdesc:Workflow. A wfdesc:Workflow contains several wfdesc:Process instances, associated using the wfdesc:hasSubProcess property. Each of these (and the workflow itself) wfdesc:hasInput and wfdesc:hasOutput some wfdesc:Parameter (wfdesc:Input or wfdesc:Output). An wfdesc:Artifact is associated with a wfdesc:Parameter using wfdesc:hasArtifact. The wfdesc:Workflow also wfdesc:hasDataLink several wfdesc:DataLink instances, which forms the connection between parameters. Thus this ontology allows the description a direct acyclic graph, or a dataflow. This ontology is meant as an upper ontology for more specific workflow definitions, and as a way to express abstract workflows. The wfprov ontology shows how to link these descriptions to a provenance trace of a workflow execution.
